subject: Update overview layout
commitMessage:
Update overview layout

Layout updates uses bootstrap vue cards to display
general information. View more links and download
or export ability has been added to the overview page.

Network settings displays the hostname and the first IP
address for the first ethernet interface. Link status
was also added.

TODO: Add idle power and power mode properties in seperate
commit for each story.

Signed-off-by: Dixsie Wolmers <dixsie@ibm.com>
Change-Id: Iaf0720d76b2a9416f068a1e779ede59bffda9727

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 6a192d526c9efebf7a614a9aa473eee62e555fc5 by Dixsie Wolmers
I think we should increase bottom margin to mb-5, with this the heading won't stick to the divider.
Done
I was wondering if we can use the table formatter for displaying '--'?
I didn’t use the table formatted because it’s not a table
Done
Can we not include both definition terms inside one dl?
Done
Why we need to display '--' when our if condition is true?
—- is displayed when it’s false. I didn’t use the table formatted because it’s not a table
Done
Same as above
Ack
What about https://github.com/openbmc/webui-vue/blob/master/src/locales/ru-RU.json ?

We are only maintaining the English translation file. Trying to manage multiple translations files is a lot of overhead and will require a lot of extra maintenance in between. It would be better to do all the translations files when the UI features are closer to done. I can CC the original contributor for the ru-RU.json

As I've said in another review I don't think you need to do anything if you add new keys. This way missing keys in a Russian translation would fallback to the English default. Community (or me personally) will eventually fix it.
I think the only thing that is needed to be checked if the keys are renamed. Some missing keys is not a problem, but when all of the keys in sections are broken because the section key was renamed this is a problem. And you don't need any Russian knowledge to fix such cases.
Ack
Could you please add this change to the ru-RU.json file?
We agreed in the community design workgroup to only maintain upstream en-US.json. I can CC you going forward on future stories so you can monitor changes.

Ok, noted.
Thanks for the suggestion, but I don't think it is necessary to CC me on every patchset with the translation changes. After all I'm not a person responsible for the `ru-RU.json` translation. I am just an independent developer.
And when I'll see broken translation I can just always look at the history of the `en-US.json` file and port the necessary changes.
